description: 1979 Pontiac Trans Am survivor. Clean, rust free, (exception is battery tray, easy fix) original down to the am radio. 403/auto. Low option car. PO spent hundreds on rebuilding 3:42 rear-end. Other new parts include: belts, hoses, radiator, water pump, plugs, wires, brakes, master cylinder, front shocks, full Flowmaster cat-delete exhaust with h-pipe. Near new BF Goodrich Radial TA's on original Ralleys. Have original build sheet and other documentation. Drives and runs great..and sounds nasty! Needs the usual minor tinkering for a near-40 year old car but very driveable and enjoyable as is. Clean and clear title.

description: Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1978 Pontiac Transam.  Excellent Condition.   HISTORY  Changes for 1978 were slight, with a switch from a honeycomb to a crosshatch pattern grille being the most obvious from the outside.[14] Beginning in 1978, the Pontiac group introduced a new special edition vehicle. The Firebird Formula LT Sport Edition which featured a revised 10% raised compression Chevy 305 V8 powertrain producing 155 hp (same as 1977 Chevy Monza Mirage) combined with a floor center console four-speed manual T-10 BW transmission coupled to a limited-slip differential final drive. The limited touring package (LT) also included a cabin roof, door, fender and hood graphics scheme, the Trans-Am sports handling package with HD gas shocks, modular alloy wheels and the SE Trans-Am rear deck spoiler with "Formula" word graphic detail. T-tops in 1978 transitioned from Hurst units to Fisher (GM) in mid year. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA  SPECIFICS / BUILD INFORMATION  EXTERIOR   -Solar Gold.   -T-Tops.   -Gold Cast Aluminum Wheels.   -Cooper GT Radials.    -Excellent Condition.   INTERIOR    -Tan Vinyl.   -Tan Carpet.   -Factory Tach.   -Power Windows.   MECHANICAL   -Pontiac (6.6L) 403 CID V8.   -Automatic Transmission.   -Factory A/C.   -Power Steering.   -Power Brakes.  DISCLOSURE  -There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint. (See detailed pictures)  For more details on any disclosure items please contact a sales agent today at 1-877-422-2940.  The cost of parts and restoration of these vehicles are increasing daily. They are not making any more and, therefore, they are becoming more rare by the day. Buy one complete and ensure your investment for the future. An excellent investment and something you can enjoy daily. Collectible vintage vehicles have historically appreciated at a rate greater than that stock market, gold and other arts and collectibles as documented by many articles and auction result tracking. COLLECTOR CAR FINANCING  800-872-1965  Please mention you are working with Worldwide Vintage Autos in order to expedite the process.  DEPOSITS:  Deposits to hold vehicles is $500. Upon payment of the $500 deposit, the vehicle will be held for 7 days pending final payment. Deposits are non-refundable due to i). the vehicles are taken off the market and we turn down other buyers during the 7 day period and ii). there is significant re-marketing costs associated with relisting / remarketing our vehicles. title: 1979 Pontiac Trans Am

description: 1979 Pontiac Trans Am (WS6)If you are looking for a stock reproduction Trans Am then this car is not for you.  If However you are looking for a top notch tastefully restored Retro- restored Trans Am then this just might be everything you are looking for.  I started with a rust free Alabama body and completely disassembled it and placed the body on a rotisserie  From there it was completely stripped of any and all paint and under coatings and epoxy primed and urethane coated for complete and lasting corrosion protection.  The Frame was prepped and tied together to the sub-frame using Global Suspension components and A G-force Transmission Cross member installed to prep it for the 600 HP Pontiac 400 motor bored and stroked to 468 cubic inches.  A 700r4 transmission with electronic lock-up converter makes it great for cruising the highway as well as plenty of power from go. A fully programmable cooling system assured you will never overheat under any circumstances.  A vacuum pump for the brakes assure plenty of assist even at idle.  All professionally built and installed.  All suspension is new and updated with urethane bushings and mounts.  Extensive research has been done to assure the best combination for drive-ability and performance.  The entire inside lower body has been covered in Eastwood sound deadener so the driver can enjoy the Pioneer stereo/CD with Rockford -Fosgate amp and Sub-woofer.  The Exhaust is from Pypes and connected by Doug's Ceramic Headers. There truly is too much too list and hundreds of photographs document the restoration process.  Please contact me for more details I have included some photos but if specific ones are wanted chances are I have one.  I built this car because I love it not to make money.  I am a Professional Body Tech with 30 years experience The body was built by me for me  with the intention of keeping it for a very long time and that is the way I built it.  I have over $40000. Invested in it not including labor.  You will not be disappointed. There is a (not very High Quality) video on youtube look up RKVO Trans Am.Vehicle is located in Gaylord MI. Financing Nationwide Shipping and Warranties available to qualified buyers.

description: 1980 Pontiac Trans Am

This 1980 Dark Carmine Trans Am is very clean.  It shows only 74,000 miles.  It looks to have one repaint.  It is powered by a 4.9L Pontiac V-8 Turbo 350 coupled to a posi-rear end. The stunning white interior and matching door panels set this car off.  It is sitting on 4 new 17" aluminum snowflake wheels with new Uniroyal Tiger Paws.  It also has the old school Cragar rear window louvers.  The stereo is a classic Sony deck with cassette.  The red carpet is very nice with carpet savers. The trunk area is very nice right down to the space saver wheel and air canister!
